intro: Memecylon parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered memecylon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Asia, including countries like India, Thailand, and Malaysia. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The small, white or yellowish flowers are arranged in clusters and are followed by small, round fruits that contain one or two seeds.
